column4: Hey, does anyone know how to stop all of the scrolling madness in 7.10???
All of the... scrolling madness... Ubuntu 7.10... madness
How to stop it
what exactly do you mean?
when I'm in FF and I scroll up/down to top/bottom of page it takes me to previous/after pages... when I'm on Ubuntu desktop and I scroll it sends me to a different workspace
I can't seem to find how to stop this from happening. I use a trackpad... so it does it accidentally all the time.
so it seems the up/down is working as side/side
well, it does up and down, but when I reach the top of the page it sends me back... when I reach the bottom, if there is a forward, it sends me forward, but it does this in Ubuntu too, not just FF
what model laptop do you have.. is it a synaptic touchpad?
actually yeah, I think so. It's a Dell Inpsiron E1505
try installing gsynaptics: sudo apt-get install gsynaptics
alright, I'll try that. brb (thx)
now do I have to restart or anything, or should it be in effect?
might have to restart x... check and see if anything is different
ok I'm going to restart. I'll be back to tell you if it worked.
yeah... still does it... not in FF though, so that's good...
i sent you a memo
how do I get it?
/msg memoserv read all
tells me i need a password... dont have one
something's wrong... When I enter "cd xserver-xorg-input-synaptics*" it tells me "No such file or directory"
should those dashes be slashes?
just do locate synaptic.c then continue from there
try using find instead of locate sry
